column4: ok i"m having wierd problems with a ubuntu system acting as a gateway i can telnet out to a remote webserver from an internal host and do a GET  and have it work but web browsers all hang and there"s nothing useful in the kernel log> any ideas?
are you telneting using the hostname or ip addr?
checked that.
and it works, you can get packets back?
also is the gateway doing any NATing or just acting as a router?
the box is NATing using hoary with the ipmasq package from universe
hrm
timeouts you said... can it determine the hostname? is it "waiting for a reply"? etc?
hostname lookups work for ping.
right right,  i'm trying to think of how the browser could be failing tho
that's what's gotten me stumped too.
no.
any more thoughts. this is driving me insane.
nah i'm sorry man... can't think of anything
hrm that odder in my opinion
I'd expect unable to contact proxy server.
found it.
linux won't fragment a packet by default.
it drops it.
hrm ahhhhhhhh
interesting
it was working I forgot I twiddled ppp options to make ssh better.
